intro: Becium ellenbeckii, commonly known as the Ellenbeck's becium, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and related plants, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique botanical features make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human encroachment.
